summary: initial identification of SARS-CoV in civet cats and other wild animals suggests zoonosis (7). later, Rhinolophus sp. bats were identified as harboring severe acute respiratory syndrome-related CoV at high frequencies. they were believed to be a natural reservoir host for SARS-CoV (8, 9) sequence-specific primers were used to fill the gaps and generate the full genome sequence, named BtKY72/Rhinolophus sp./Kenya/2007. complete genome sequencing was not performed due to limited viral loads in fecal samples from the other four betacoronavirus-positive bats.
